bill_title: place a moratorium on certain new outdoor advertising permits, to create a task force to review the state laws regulating outdoor advertising along state highways, and to declare an emergency.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to place a moratorium on certain new outdoor advertising permits, to create a task force to review the state laws regulating outdoor advertising along state highways, and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The Department of Transportation shall issue no new permits pursuant § 31-29-71 until July 1, 2003. Section 2. There is hereby established an outdoor advertising task force. The task force shall review chapter 31-29 and the process used to regulate outdoor advertising along interstate and primary highways. The task force shall explore whether these laws need to be revised. The task force shall make its recommendations to the 2003 Legislature. The task force shall be appointed by the Governor. Section 3. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the immediate preservation of the public peace, health, or safety, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
